features: MADE WITH CHI FLAT IRON TECHNOLOGY. Designed using the same titanium-infused ceramic soleplate technology that powers CHI’s hair styling tools, including the flagship CHI G2 Flat Iron.
POWERFUL STEAM FOR EFFORTLESS IRONING. With over 300 steam holes and 1700 watts of power, this clothing iron delivers powerful steam that makes the process of steaming out wrinkles smooth and fast.
DIGITAL CONTROL DIAL WITH FABRIC GUIDE. Choose your fabric type using the illuminated control, and the iron sets the temperature accordingly, eliminating the guesswork.
PRECISE CONTROL. A unique, adjustable steam lever goes from no steam to full power with just a quick slide. And the sleek handle with textured grip gives you complete control and comfort.
PREMIUM MATERIALS WITH MODERN STYLE. The titanium-infused ceramic soleplate is ultra-strong and scratch-resistant. Matte chrome accents and a sleek design give this clothing iron a polished look.
100% QUALITY TESTED: All CHI irons are pre-tested at the factory to ensure excellent quality when it arrives to your home. Condensation may be visible in the steam chamber from this test.
body.description: Whether your definition of a polished look is a well-pressed suit, a smooth silk dress or a wrinkle-free shirt for work, you can achieve it with the CHI Electronic Iron. Like our haircare tools, this iron is designed to give you the high-performance power of the pros at home.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: CHI Flat Iron Technology Engineered with a titanium-infused ceramic soleplate similar to our popular CHI flat irons, the Professional Clothing Iron is durable enough to withstand scratches, heats up quickly and provides an extra-smooth glide.

From Hair to Wear From the world-renowned brand that has innovated the haircare industry for over 30 years, comes a high-performance line of irons and steamers for all the fabrics of your home and wardrobe. Engineered with CHI flat iron technology, and designed for the modern home, these products deliver the precise results you can only expect from CHI. Whether you want to create a flawless look from head to toe, or have a perfectly-pressed outfit for your workday, it’s now easier than ever to achieve with CHI. CHI Steam Iron with Electronic Temperature Control Powerful steam, precise temperature, professional results Whether your definition of a polished look is a well-pressed suit, a smooth silk dress or a wrinkle-free shirt for work, you can achieve it with the CHI Professional Clothing Iron. Like our haircare tools, this iron is designed to give you the high-performance power of the pros at home. Ironing is simpler than ever with a temperature dial that includes a fabric guide, adjustable steam control and an easy to grasp, comfortable handle. Titanium-infused ceramic soleplate Over 300 steam holes for superior performance Precise temperature Electronic controls: - Precise temperature for every fabric - Indicates when iron is ready - Unique adjustable steam control Comfort grip 10’ cord

Features: Powerful Steam With over 300 steam holes and 1700 watts of power, this iron delivers powerful steam that makes the process of steaming out wrinkles smooth and fast. Advanced Electronic Controls The temperature control selector lets you choose your fabric type and sets the temperature accordingly, eliminating the guesswork. A unique, adjustable steam lever goes from no steam to full power with just a quick slide. Electronic controls indicate when iron is ready. Modern Style, Premium Materials and Smart Details The titanium-infused ceramic soleplate is ultra-strong and scratch-resistant. The handle’s textured grip gives you complete control and comfort, while a 10-foot cord offers flexibility. Matte chrome accents and a sleek design give this iron a polished look.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best iron ever!
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had many many irons over my 45+ years of marriage. Some expensive and some less expensive. This one beats them all! Yes…I still iron our clothes! It heats up fast and produces excellent steam. It’s not too heavy and the controls are very easy to use. It also has an exceptionally long cord. The water chamber is very easy to see. Overall…A+++

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love this iron. It is very hot and lots of steam for the weight of the iron. I like that it stays on longer before automatically shutting off, not so many beeps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lovely Chi Iron: Even perfect for heavy linen or cotton!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this Chi Iron for my sewing room. I wanted a Rowenta level iron, but have been concerned with the negative reviews on their irons recently. My setup uses a silicone iron rest and a large wool pressing mat on the end of my large work table. When it first arrived I set it up and was impressed with hot fast it heated. This iron is more wattage than I’ve owned previously. I get a small amount of dimming on lights that are plugged into my outlets, but I expected that. I sew with mostly woven fabrics of varying weights, linen and cotton. I filled the water tank. Steamed up a wrinkled linen. Not “insanely crisp” after one pass but not wrinkled. But it was leaking from the handle right below the water tank lid. I emptied the while thing out, refilled carefully. Aaaand leaking again. I messaged Amazon and they had a replacement at my house the next day. I was able to choose my local Whole Foods for the returned package and dropping it there was easy peasy. The counter was at the front of the store, they scanned the barcode in my Amazon App and showed me the confirmation on their end. Three seconds. And I needed bread so that was perfect. The second iron worked just as great with no leaking at all. I’ve been using it a month now and I am still in love with it. Best features: Heats fast fast fast, from cold to whatever temp you pick. Water tank holds a lot of water and is easy to see where the water level is located. Steam is fantastic. Buttons are easy to push and the cap for the water flips up easily. (My last iron had a water cap that was more like a secret door because it was so hard to open without a nail file or something tiny) Oh and it’s easy to see what setting and if the iron is on from far away because of the light at the base of the handle and the large letters on the settings that light up. Oh, AND the cord is so long I can plug it in 5 feet away and still have room to navigate.Cons: Small hole for water. See photos, I use my tiny watering can and it’s perfect!! The nose of the iron isn’t quite as thin as I wanted, but it is still okay.See photos for visuals. 💕

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good performance; bad button placement
reviews.reviewText: After having used Rowenta irons for almost 20 years, their drop in quality even in "German made" models made me reconsider purchasing that brand, so I ended up with a Chi. Compared to my previous iron this model is a little smaller and much lighter, but it performs well so I am not missing the size of my other iron. It heats up faster than the Rowenta and plays a beep both when turning on, and also beeps when reaching the target temperature. The titanium dioxide coated plate slides smoothly over clothes and the plate doesn't snag on shirt buttons, unlike my previous iron. So far no water leaks, although I did notice this iron doesn't produce as much steam as the Rowenta with the electronic pump did so you have to go easy on it.Cord is longer and doesn't snag, but I noticed there is a tendency for the strain relief part to get caught up on the ironing board which sometimes makes the iron unstead when placed on end quickly. This isn't a deal breaker but it may get annoying.More annoying is that Chi decided to place the single temperature change button right on the top surface of the handle below the steam button, which is the logical place to put your hand when applying pressure to cuffs or collars. Applying enough pressure to the button will of course cause the temperature to change, so you then have to stop ironing, and press the button five or six times to slowly cycle back to your desired temperature. At least the iron beeps to warn you that you pressed the button, but why not put it literally anywhere else on the iron? Despite this design issue causing grief three or four times already, I'm still pretty happy with the iron which costs less than half of what a Rowenta cost me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have always used another brand iron but the last 2 I bought were not good. I used this iron at my moms and loved it. I’ve been using it awhile now & it does not disappoint. The steam power is amazing, settings are easy to set.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I wanted!
reviews.reviewText: I am really happy with this iron. It is well designed and performs very well. Perfect weight, perfect steam distribution, no drips, precision temp setting. I use it for table linens, button front shirts, other clothes. I think it would be good for sewing projects as it stays “on” for 30 minutes between uses. My previous iron was made by a famous European brand known for their irons and this Chi iron by far exceeds the performance my old one. Glad I spent a little more to get this one - laundry day is easier!
Muy buena calidad y desarruga muy bien la ropa, lo recomiendo.

Me encanto !!! La entrega fue anticipada esta plancha es mejor de lo que esperaba , planche muy rápido !!! Se desliza increíble y en un dos por tres termine !!! No podía creerlo , es una maravillaMe enamore de esta plancha !!!!Se las súper recomiendo de verdad !!!
Es súper ligera, no necesitas voltear la ropa, la mejor que he tenido
